newsitem.title: USA: Anheuser to boost stake in Grupo Modelo.
newsitem.headline: Anheuser to boost stake in Grupo Modelo.

text.p: Anheuser-Busch Cos Inc said Wednesday it will increase its ownership in Grupo Modelo S.A. de C.V. and its subsidiaries to 37 percent for an investment of about $550 million.
Grupo Modelo, the No. 1 brewer in Mexico, is known for its Corona brand.

In 1993, Anheuser-Busch acquired a 17.7 percent direct and indirect interest in Grupo Modelo and its subsidiary, Diblo, for $477 million, with options to increase its holdings at any time between mid-1995 and the end of 1997.
The transaction is expected to close in late January 1997.
As a result of the investment, the number of seats Anheuser-Busch holds on the Modelo board will rise to 10 from the current three.

The total number of seats on the Modelo board will increase to 21 from the current 14. Grupo Modelo vice chairman Carlos Fernandez G. is a director of Anheuser-Busch. Antonio Fernandez R. is an advisory member of Anheuser-Busch's board.
Modelo is the exclusive importer and distributor of Budweiser and other Anheuser-Busch brands in Mexico.
Modelo brands are brewed at seven breweries throughout Mexico.

Anheuser-Busch, the world's largest brewer, sold 87.5 million barrels of beer in 1995. Through the first three quarters of 1996, it sold 70 million barrels of beer, representing a 44.8 percent market share, according to the Beer Institute.
